item.title: Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea Ukulele Play Along
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for CGEA ukulele. Keys of F and A.
Chords Used: F, Dm, Gm, C7, F7, Bb, Bbm,, C+, A, F#m, Bm, E7, G, Eb, C#7, Bdim7, Dm7
Original performance by George Harrison
[Corrected Version from the Original Upload]
Our local ukulele group is working on this song, and I was asked to check out the chords they are using (and the tablature they are using), and I made a play along video (there is no tablature in this song).
Do you enjoy these videos? If so, please click on the tutorial video and subscribe to the sister channel to this channel. This channel will feature only video play alongs, and the sister channel will feature all of my original content.
Tutorial Video (History, GCEA chords, & strumming) on the sister channel (please subscribe!): https://youtu.be/8bll9-iQLW8
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The baritone ukulele chord font is from ukefarm.com.
The Motion background video is from motionbolt.com
There is a master list of all similar play along videos at my blog: ukestuff.info. Access to the blog, and all materials on the blog is free.
Check out the Ukulele Video Play Along Podcast, where I talk about ukulele education and my own ukulele experiences. Available on Apple Podcasts, Google Play, Spotify, and Stitcher.
Thanks for watching the videos and supporting the channel!

item.title: Dawn - Tie a Yellow Ribbon Round the Ole Oak Tree
item.description: Performed by Tony Orlando & Dawn Written by Irwin Levine & L. Russel Brown

item.title: Carpenter Brut - Turbo Killer
item.description:
Performed & written by Carpenter Brut
Something for those who fancy a challenge. Also, not many synthwave play-alongs around.

item.title: Twenty One Pilots - House Of Gold
item.description:
Ukulele play along
House Of Gold - Twenty One Pilots
Using the chords: C F G A7 Am Dm Bbm ** A good chance to practice the B flat minor chord! **
Suggested Strum Patterns: D DU U DU or D DU DU DU - it is fast
Notes: Tyler Joseph plays a C chord for the first section (chorus). I have used the chords as a guide to help singing but you can play a C chord if you prefer.
This video is meant for educational purposes.
No copyright infringement intended

item.title: Varios Artistas - Jar of Hearts
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of F. Transposed up a whole step from the original in Eb.
As performed by Christina Perri.
What an absolutely gorgeous song. The bridge is stunning, and the ending going from dim7 to tonic is outstanding. And it works well with the ukulele. I may try placing this in G, which would be even easier to play on the ukulele—not sure how it will sound in that key (transposed up two whole steps). The tricky chords are the Bb and the Bbm, and as things go, those aren’t too bad.
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com.
Are these ukulele resources valuable to you? If so, consider following my blog at ukestuff.info, and becoming a patron at www.patreon.com/cjrphd. There is a master list of all similar play along videos at ukestuff.info.

item.title: Alessia Cara - How Far I'll Go
item.description:
For educational use. Optimized for GCEA ukulele. Key of F.
As performed by Alessia Cara
The audio has been adjusted to move from the original Key of E to F, and then to remove the key change at the end. Note the barre chords: Bbm, Bb, F, and Fmaj7 (These last two occur at the end)
Video created on the iPad Pro using Luma Fusion. The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com. The

item.title: Burn The Ballroom - Crazy
item.description:
For educational purposes--all rights remain with the group.
"Crazy" by Burn the Ballroom. In the Key of F (F, A, Dm, Bb, Bbm, C, C7). I heard this song as bumper music on the Tony Kornheiser Show--and it stick in my head as a great song for a ukulele play along. The lyrics may not be appropriate for young students. The melody is wonderful!
This song was fun to work out, as the chords were not readily available on various "tab" websites.
The group's albums and this song can be found on iTunes and Amazon. You can also access the group's YouTube recording: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WrSlr2LxdDk
The ukulele chord font is Chordette for Education, available at ukefarm.com
